item.title: Cultural variation in response scales
item.description: paper-notes research-extradisciplinary research-culture Academic results RESPONSE STYLE AND CROSS-CULTURAL COMPARISONS OF RATING SCALES AMONG EAST ASIAN AND NORTH AMERICAN STUDENTS Responses to fifty-seven 7-point Likert-type scales were analyzed.

item.title: Dispatch from COLM
item.description: blogpost-other COLM was a blast! Here I’ll summarize takeaways I had from poster discussions for 9 cool papers, and I’ll give some of my own reflections on the conference overall.

item.title: Wtf is a persona?!
item.description: Sometimes “persona” in LMs refers to an output persona, ie the thing that describes the human-like behavior the LM is supposed to simulate Other times it refers to input personas, ie the data that models the kind of users the LM is interacting with (in lieu of fully real interactions with the model ...

item.description: paper-notes links Code reasoning caused by RLVR (one sample RL paper) Code reasoning also caused just by random rewards “Compound” reward: we still give spurious reward but don’t reward generating python Code reasoning behavior removed Performance drops!
